Class MyQueue<E>

java.lang.Object
implementations.MyQueue<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements stored in this queue
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, QueueADT<E>
public class MyQueue<E> extends Object implements QueueADT<E>
Array-based implementation of the Queue Abstract Data Type (ADT). This implementation uses a circular array to efficiently manage space and provides O(1) enqueue and dequeue operations (amortized).
See Also:

      Throws:

    • enqueue

      public void enqueue(E element) throws NullPointerException

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Throws:

      public boolean equals(QueueADT<E> that)

      Specified by:

      Returns:
      true if equal, false otherwise

    • toArray

      public Object[] toArray()
      Returns an array containing all elements in the queue. The front element is at index 0 of the array.

      array of queue elements

    • toArray

      public E[] toArray(E[] holder)
      Converts the queue to an array of the same runtime type as the specified array. The front element is at index 0.
      Specified by:
      toArray in interface QueueADT<E>
      Parameters:
      holder - the array into which the elements of the queue are to be stored, if it is big enough; otherwise, a new array of the same runtime type is allocated.
      Returns:
      an array containing the elements of the queue
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the holder array is null

    • iterator

      public Iterator<E> iterator()
      Returns a custom iterator over this queue. Traverses elements from front to rear.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface QueueADT<E>
      Returns:
      an iterator for this queue

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the queue. Elements are listed from front to rear.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string representation of queue

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Returns true if the queue is full. Since this queue resizes dynamically, this always returns false.
      Specified by:
      isFull in interface QueueADT<E>
      Returns:
      false always

    • contains

      public boolean contains(E target)
      Returns true if the queue contains the specified element. Uses equals() to check for equality.
      Specified by:
      contains in interface QueueADT<E>
      Parameters:
      target - the element to search for
      Returns:
      true if the element is found, false otherwise

    • search

      public int search(E target)
      Returns the 1-based position of the element in the queue starting from front. Returns -1 if the element is not found.
      Specified by:
      search in interface QueueADT<E>
      Parameters:
      target - the element to search for
      Returns:
      position from front (1-based), or -1 if not found
